newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Telecom, forestry send NZ shares to higher close.
newsitem.headline: Telecom, forestry send NZ shares to higher close.

text.p: * Telecom, forestry lead New Zealand stocks higher
* DB Group rises post result
* Steel and Tube in recovery mode
Price movements at close
LAST CHG * NZSE40 cap index +17.42 at 2,384.97

729 +12 * Other movers - +25 +3
A sharp gain in index heavyweight Telecom plus a solid improvement in the forestry sector hoisted the New Zealand share market to a respectable gain by the close of a busy Wednesday session.
The NZSE-40 Capital Index ended 17.42 points higher at 2,384.97 on strong turnover worth nearly NZ$83 million.
Brokers said the market started the session on a modestly firmer note in a muted response to Wall Street's record close.
First NZ Capital broker Vicki St John said Telecom's 12 cent gain to NZ$7.29 was the main driver, but several of the other majors had also posted solid gains.
Telecom's gain was due to stronger offshore buying, attractive yields and continued share price support from the buyback, dealers said.
DB Group gained three cents to NZ$2.25 after reporting slightly higher than expected first half net profit of NZ$17.16 million, up from $16 million a year earlier.
"Operationally it was a good result, particularly in a market that has been declining, in terms of the overall beer market," St John said.
"So to have a result that was flat at the EBIT line in this environment is a pretty good result," she said.
Steel and Tube spent another day on the recovery trail, gaining 25 to NZ$7.30, having started the week at $6.80.

Restaurant Brands, floated earlier this month, continued its strong run, ending at NZ$2.55, up three, but one cent off its historical high. It floated at NZ$2.20, so has offered investors a gross gain of nearly 16 percent in a week.
